answers.author: George Jones
answers.text:
I have always built it into the salary budgets since it is part of compensation.  If you have the annual salary, leave time is included.  The only exception to that is when a person is retiring and has an accumulation of vacation or other leave that will be compensated for.  Amounts accrued in prior fiscal years should have been expensed and accrued in each of those years so it should not affect expenses in the year of retirement or resignation.

Don't forget to check back to the Knowledge Network topic page for Budgeting.

author: Matthew Lane
text: I am curious about how others budget for PTO (paid time off) or vacation time.  Do you budget for it in separate accounts or build it into the salary line, track it in a line without budgeting for it and reconcile the difference at the end of the year?
title: Budgeting and Accounting for PTO
